intro: Bupleurum sulcatum, commonly known as the grooved bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Bupleurum sulcatum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, high-altitude environments.
